title: How to Take Care of and Have Fun with a Beanie Boo

steps.headline: Check your Beanie Boo's heart tag.
steps.description: Read its birthday, name, and story. If you don't like the name, you can rename it.

steps.headline: Choose a personality for your Beanie Boo.
steps.description: You could make it funny, shy, active or bossy, or a mixture of these.

steps.headline: Buy it a friend.
steps.description: No one wants to be lonely, so buy a friend for it. It does not have to be a Beanie Boo, it can be any toy.

steps.headline: Feed the Beanie Boo.
steps.description: You can make little food out of clay or buy fake food for it. You can also feed it real food but that can get a bit messy.

steps.headline: Give the Beanie Boo a bath.
steps.description: Make it a pretend bath. If there is a mark or stain on the Beanie Boo, use a slightly damp washcloth, then dampen the Beanie Boo very slightly as you wipe away the stain.

steps.headline: Make the Beanie Boo accessories.
steps.description: Make friendship bracelets. Using a Rainbow Loom is an easy way to do this.

steps.headline: Show it the outside world!
steps.description: Take your Beanie Boo to the park, mall, school, anywhere, even on vacation. They like to have fun too! However, make sure that you keep your eyes on them at all times; if you lose them, you may never see them again.

steps.headline: Have parties.
steps.description: Have parties like birthday parties. If you forget a birthday, look at the tag. If you lose the tag, make up a birthday, such as the day you got your Beanie Boo. If you want to use its real birthday, go to this site and search up the tag name of your Beanie Boo.

steps.headline: Bring it to sleepovers.
steps.description: Your friends might have another Beanie Boo for it to play with.

steps.headline: Have fun with your Beanie Boo.
steps.description: The main thing is to have a huge amount of fun and creative play.

text: Getting the Beanie Boo Check your Beanie Boo's heart tag. Read its birthday, name, and story. If you don't like the name, you can rename it. Choose a personality for your Beanie Boo. You could make it funny, shy, active or bossy, or a mixture of these. Buy it a friend. No one wants to be lonely, so buy a friend for it. It does not have to be a Beanie Boo, it can be any toy. Caring for the Beanie Boo Feed the Beanie Boo. You can make little food out of clay or buy fake food for it. You can also feed it real food but that can get a bit messy. Give the Beanie Boo a bath. Make it a pretend bath. If there is a mark or stain on the Beanie Boo, use a slightly damp washcloth, then dampen the Beanie Boo very slightly as you wipe away the stain. Make the Beanie Boo accessories. Make friendship bracelets. Using a Rainbow Loom is an easy way to do this. Doing Things Together Show it the outside world! Take your Beanie Boo to the park, mall, school, anywhere, even on vacation. They like to have fun too! However, make sure that you keep your eyes on them at all times; if you lose them, you may never see them again. Have parties. Have parties like birthday parties. If you forget a birthday, look at the tag. If you lose the tag, make up a birthday, such as the day you got your Beanie Boo. If you want to use its real birthday, go to this site and search up the tag name of your Beanie Boo. Bring it to sleepovers. Your friends might have another Beanie Boo for it to play with. Have fun with your Beanie Boo. The main thing is to have a huge amount of fun and creative play.
